page.title: 07Passenger Rail Link to Corby
page.content: Corby councillors have been pushing hard to get the passenger railway link between Kettering and Corby re-opened. The passenger service was closed in 1966 when Corby station was also shut down.Malcolm Southgate,general manager of B.R. in the Midlands,and Ray Cross, chairman of Northamptonshire Council's public transport study group,were among officials who attended a meeting to discuss the possible re-opening.Corby councillors would like a new station built on the former steelworks site. Surveys show that Corby would provide at least 150 000 passengers a year and if the new Wonderworld leisure complex is built,passengers into Corby are ex- pected to top the million mark each year. Support for Corby's campaign was unanimously pledged by representatives from other local councils at a special meeting.
